level.platforms

Class Platform

  • java.lang.Object
    • level.platforms.Platform
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasicPlatform, MovingPlatform, Spawn

    public abstract class Platform
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a platform object with enough information for most uses.
    Author:
    James Talbert

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int PLATFORM_HEIGHT
      The height of a platform object, used for rendering and collision detection (getRect()).
      static int PLATFORM_WIDTH
      The width of a platform object, used for rendering and collision detection (getRect()).
      protected boolean tangible
      Weather or not the platform can physically interact with other game objects.
      protected int type
      The type of platform, unused as of Dec.
      protected double x
      The logical horizontal position of a platform (from left).
      protected double y
      The logical vertical position of a platform (from top).

    • Field Detail

      • PLATFORM_WIDTH

        public static final int PLATFORM_WIDTH
        The width of a platform object, used for rendering and collision detection (getRect()).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PLATFORM_HEIGHT

        public static final int PLATFORM_HEIGHT
        The height of a platform object, used for rendering and collision detection (getRect()).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • x

        protected double x
        The logical horizontal position of a platform (from left). Use getRect() for collision detection and rendering.

      • y

        protected double y
        The logical vertical position of a platform (from top). Use getRect() for collision detection and rendering.

      • type

        protected int type
        The type of platform, unused as of Dec. 10, 2014. Usable for quick identification of generic platform types.

      • tangible

        protected boolean tangible
        Weather or not the platform can physically interact with other game objects. Example: a tangible platform can collide with a moving platform (causing a direction change), an intangible object cannot.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Platform

        public Platform()

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public static void setUp()
        Initializes the types HashMap. Must be called once before getPlatform(...) is ever called.

      • getPlatform

        public static Platform getPlatform(java.lang.String token,
                   int x,
                   int y)
        Looks in the types HashMap for a match for the token, and if a match is found, returns the platform created by makePlatform.
        Parameters:
        token - the string to be matched and evaluated into a platform.
        x - the current horizontal location in the level file, may be used by makePlatform(...) to position the new Platform object.
        y -
        Returns:
        the platform specified by the token

      • isCollidingWith

        public boolean isCollidingWith(java.awt.Rectangle r)
        Determines if this platform is colliding with the given rectangle in such a way that this platform should react (as defined in the update code for the platform. Probably used by update(...).
        Parameters:
        r - the rectangle that is being checked.
        Returns:
        true if they intersect in a way that would illicit a reaction from this Platform.

      • isCollidingWith

        public boolean isCollidingWith(Platform p)
        Checks for a collision with the given platform, use when evaluating any Platform collisions as it allows for more detailed analysis.
        Parameters:
        p - the platform that may be colliding with this
        Returns:
        true if they intersect in a way that would illicit a reaction from this Platform.
        See Also:
        isCollidingWith(Rectangle)

      • getRect

        public java.awt.Rectangle getRect()
        Gets the bounding Rectangle of the Platform.
        Returns:
        the bounding rectangle of the platform in pixels not logical grid spaces.

      • makePlatform

        public abstract Platform makePlatform(java.lang.String str,
                    java.lang.Integer x,
                    java.lang.Integer y)
        Parses the input and makes a new Platform from the String.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to be parsed, matched by the subclasses "static final String regex".
        x - the location that the token occurred in the level file.
        y - the location that the token occurred in the level file.
        Returns:
        the new platform.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(java.awt.Graphics g)
        draws the representation of the object in the top left corner of the provided graphics object
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object to be used

      • update

        public abstract void update(long currentTime,
          Level level)
        Updates the Platform object. Implementations will vary greatly among subclasses.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - the current system time, not the interval.
        level - the level the platform is in, necessary for collision checking.
